0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono:
• Hyperammonemia, type III, Acute treatment; Adjunct: Initial, 100 to 250 mg/kg/day divided into 2 to 4 doses and rounded to the nearest 100 mg; disperse in water and give ORALLY or through NG TUBE immediately before meals or feedings; titrate based on plasma ammonia levels and clinical symptoms
  • Hyperammonemia, type III, Chronic treatment: Individualize to achieve the target normal plasma ammonia level based on patient age; divide total daily dose into 2 to 4 doses and round to the nearest 100 mg; disperse in water and give ORALLY or through NG TUBE immediately before a meal or feeding.

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono:
• Hyperammonemia, type III, Acute treatment; Adjunct: Initial, 100 to 250 mg/kg/day divided into 2 to 4 doses; disperse in water and give ORALLY or through NG TUBE immediately before meals or feedings; titrate based on plasma ammonia levels and clinical symptoms
  • Hyperammonemia, type III, Chronic treatment: Individualize to achieve the target normal plasma ammonia level based on patient age; divide total daily dose into 2 to 4 doses, disperse in water and give ORALLY or through NG TUBE immediately before a meal or feeding.

3.title: Indications
3.mono:
FDA-Labeled Indications
  • Hyperammonemia, type III, Acute treatment; Adjunct
  • Hyperammonemia, type III, Chronic treatment

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono: Specific contraindications have not been determined

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• Endocrine and Metabolic:
  • -- Acute symptomatic hyperammonemia may occur, including possible brain injury or death; preventative therapy (complete protein restriction) and ongoing monitoring recommended

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

5.title: Adverse Effects
5.mono:
Common
  • Gastrointestinal:Abdominal pain (17%), Diarrhea (13%), Vomiting (26%)
  • Hematologic:Anemia (13%), Decreased hemoglobin (13%)
  • Neurologic:Headache (13%)
  • Otic:Infection of ear (13%)
  • Respiratory:Nasopharyngitis (13%), Tonsillitis (17%)
  • Other:Fever (17%), Infectious disease (13%)

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Carglumic acid, a synthetic analogue of N-acetylglutamate (NAG), activates carbomoyl phosphate synthetase-1 in hepatic mitochondria which allows for the conversion of ammonia to urea.

sub.title: Excretion
sub.mono:
• Fecal: 60% unchanged
  • Renal: 4.5% to 9% unchanged
  • Renal clearance: 290 mL/minute
  • Total body clearance: 5.7 L/minute

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
• Nasogastric
    • (Adults) Immediately before administration, mix each tablet with at least 2.5 mL of water and shake gently.
    • (Pediatrics) Immediately before administration, mix each tablet with at least 2.5 mL of water to a concentration of 80 mg/mL and shake gently.
    • Administer immediately before a feeding.
    • (Adults) Immediately after preparation, administer through a NG tube and flush with additional water.
    • (Pediatrics) Immediately after preparation, draw the appropriate volume, administer through a NG tube, and flush with additional water; discard unused portion.
  • Oral
    • (Adults) Immediately before administration, disperse each tablet in at least 2.5 mL of water; Do not mix in other foods or liquids besides water.
    • (Pediatrics) Immediately before administration, mix each tablet with at least 2.5 mL of water to a concentration of 80 mg/mL and shake gently.
    • Do not crush or swallow tablets whole.
    • Administer immediately before a meal.
    • (Adults) Administer immediately after preparation. Rinse mixing container with water and administer remaining contents (including undissolved portion of tablets).
    • (Pediatrics) Immediately after preparation, draw the appropriate volume in an oral syringe and administer; discard the unused portion. Refill the oral syringe with at least 1 to 2 mL of water and administer immediately.

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono:
• Normalization of plasma ammonia level for age is indicative of clinical response
  • Plasma ammonia levels; during treatment
  • Neurologic status; on an ongoing basis

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• Advise patient to take all drugs that are prescribed for their hyperammonemia.
  • This drug may cause abdominal pain, pyrexia, tonsillitis, and vomiting.
  • Patient should disperse 200-mg tablet in a minimum of 2.5 mL of water and drink immediately. Additional water should be added to mixing container for any residual medicine and the contents ingested immediately.
  • Instruct patient to mix only with water and not with other liquids or food.
  • Advise patient to adhere to restrictions in protein intake, until instructed otherwise.
